info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 7:57PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Siskiyou and southeastern Josephine Counties through 830 PM PDT... At 756 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bolan Lake Campground, or 13 miles southeast of Cave Junction, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cave Junction, Takilma, Williams, Grayback Mountain Trail, Bolan Lake Campground, Oregon Caves and Provolt. This includes the following highways... US 199 in Oregon between mile markers 27 and 34. US 20 east in Oregon MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
